2.3.1.1.3. all_tests.TestDateTime¶

class all_tests.TestDateTime(methodName='runTest')¶
__init__(methodName='runTest')¶

Create an instance of the class that will use the named test method when executed. Raises a ValueError if the instance does not have a method with the specified name.

Methods

__init__([methodName]) Create an instance of the class that will use the named test method when executed.

test_010() to_seconds_since_epoch() assumes naive datetime is in UTC
test_020() to_seconds_since_epoch() honors timezone (MST, UTC-7)
test_030() to_seconds_since_epoch() honors timezone (YEKT, UTC+6)
test_100() to_http_datetime() assumes naive datetime is in UTC
test_110() to_http_datetime() honors timezone (MST, UTC-7)
test_120() to_http_datetime() honors timezone (YEKT, UTC+6)
test_200() from_http_datetime(): RFC 822, updated by RFC 1123
test_210() from_http_datetime(): RFC 850, obsoleted by RFC 1036
test_220() from_http_datetime(): ANSI C’s asctime() format
test_300() is_utc() is false for naive datetime
test_310() is_utc() is false for timezone aware datetime not at UTC (MST, UTC-7)
test_320() is_utc() is false for timezone aware datetime not at UTC (YEKT, UTC+6)
test_330() is_utc() is true for timezone aware datetime at UTC
test_400() normalize_datetime_to_utc() raises TypeError for naive datetime and no timezone arg
test_410() normalize_datetime_to_utc() does raise exception for non-conflicting timezones
test_420() normalize_datetime_to_utc() raises TypeError conflicting timezones
test_430() normalize_datetime_to_utc() returns correct result for timezone aware datetime
test_440() normalize_datetime_to_utc() returns correct result for naive datetime and timezone arg
